docs.text: for " original sin , " the road to the screen has been rocky .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: initially slated for release last november , the film was bumped twice , finally landing in the dog days of summer 2001 .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: advance screenings of the film were denied to all but a few critics , generally a sign that the studio realizes it has a dud on its hands .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: so is " original sin " really all that bad ?
docs.label: negative

docs.text: yes it is , but the melodrama does offer some rewards .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the location settings are gorgeous and there is a healthy sprinkling of t&a ( with angelina jolie providing the " t " and antonio banderas the " a " ) .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: more importantly , the movie is entertainingly bad .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: veteran readers know that , as a rule , i don't encourage people to patronize lousy films .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: most of the time , there are plenty of quality offerings on the marketplace that are more deserving of our money and besides , the " let's go laugh at the failings of others " mindset reflects an elitism that makes me uncomfortable .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: but things are different this summer .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: quality films , to put it mildly , have been few and far between , so as far as i'm concerned , it's fair to find our kicks where we may .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: " original sin " will never join such treasures as " valley of the dolls , " " road house " and " showgirls " in the bad movie hall of fame , but it'll do until something worse comes along .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the film , adapted by director michael cristofer from the cornell woolrich novel , " waltz into darkness " ( which was also the source for the 1969 francois truffaut film , " mississippi mermaid " ) , opens in a turn-of-the-century prison , as jolie's character , slated for a dawn execution , tells her lurid tale to a priest who appears desperately horny .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the freshman writing class tone is quickly established when she says things like , " this is not a love story , it is a story about love . "
docs.label: negative

docs.text: wary of local gold-diggers , cuban coffee dealer luis antonio vargas ( banderas ) makes arrangements to secure a mail order bride from america , listing himself as a mere clerk to dissuade foreign gold-diggers .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: a practical man , luis chooses a frumpy looking lady , hoping she will be a loyal mate able to provide him with children .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: imagine his surprise when his fianc ? e , julia russell ( jolie ) , turns out to be infinitely more attractive than the woman in the photo .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: julia explains that she sent a different woman's image because she didn't want to be selected solely for her pretty face .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: luis then confesses his deception , leading julie to state , with great significance , " we have something in common , we are both not to trusted . "
docs.label: negative

docs.text: after their wedding , luis and julia retire for a glorious night of carefully choreographed lovemaking , with their bodies positioned to display her breasts and his bottom as erotically as possible .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: jolie and banderas are attractive people and watching them naked is fun , although the filmmakers' insistence on using one of banderas' legs to cover jolie's crotch makes it look like he's trying to climb her .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: luis , the stupidest man who ever lived , immediately instructs the bank to make his personal and business accounts available to julia , despite the fact that she seems nothing like the woman with whom he corresponded .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: his blissful ignorance continues as the warning signs mount up .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: luis must force julia to write to her sister emily , who is frantic over her lack of communication .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: shortly after julia complains about the chirping of a pet bird , it is found on the floor of its cage with a broken neck .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: finally , when she cleans out his accounts and disappears , luis begins to suspect that something might be wrong .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: incidentally , if you're afraid i'm giving too much away , rest assured that all of this happens in the first 30 minutes of the movie , leaving plenty of time for numerous dopey plot twists , a great deal of operatic acting and more footage of her tits and his ass .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: along the way , private detective walter downs ( played by thomas jane , who was terrific as mickey mantle in the hbo movie " 61 * " ) turns up , hired by the frumpy woman's sister to find out what happened to the real julia .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: luis is also eager for the detective to track down the con artist , having decided that if he can't have her , he will kill her .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: oh , the pathos of it all .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the cast appears to recognize the trashiness of the story , adjusting their performances accordingly .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: banderas is suitably impassioned , while jolie alternates between vamping and pouting ( and with those lips , she can really pout ) .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: as for thomas jane , he starts off acting suspicious and cagey , then accelerates to a snidely whiplash level of nastiness .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: his most startling moment comes when , to prove his power to humiliate , he forces luis against a wall , verbally taunts him while rubbing his cheeks against those of luis and then finishes establishing his dominance with a full-on kiss .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: if anyone ever questions the difference between sex and rape , show them this chilling scene .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: and if anyone ever questions the difference between real drama and a laughable potboiler , show them " original sin . "
docs.label: negative
